news.title: These Big Companies Have Cut the Most Daily Ad Dollars During the Facebook Boycott
news.description: In response to the way Facebook has handled hate speech and discrimination, large businesses including Samsung and Starbucks slashed their July ad spending on the platform.

news.title: TikTok Is Launching a $200 Million Fund to Pay Creators for Their Videos
news.description: In its first major monetization campaign, video app TikTok is seeking to support content creators who have a baseline follower count and who aim to create a livelihood on the app.

news.title: Twitter Says Hackers Viewed 36 Accounts’ Private Messages
news.description: A recent breach at Twitter led to the exposure of dozens of users’ direct messages, right around the same time that 45 high profile accounts were hacked to send out a Bitcoin scam.

news.title: Steve Wozniak Sues YouTube Over Ongoing Bitcoin Scams
news.description: The Apple co-founder has filed a lawsuit against YouTube for allowing people to use his name and likeness to promote Bitcoin scams on the network despite his requests to stop them.

news.title: Facebook Enables 50-Person Live Streams With Messenger Rooms
news.description: Video group chats for up to 50 people can now be broadcast on Facebook Live, which has seen a major spike in usage due to social distancing restrictions associated with COVID-19.

news.title: Facebook Brings Small Business Fundraisers to Instagram
news.description: Small companies can now raise money on Instagram via the same mechanism that is available on Facebook for users who wish to attract funds to causes they care about.
